title: Connection (affine bundle)
summary: Let Y → X be an affine bundle modelled over a vector bundle Y → X. A connection Γ on Y → X is called the affine connection if it as a section Γ : Y → J1Y of the jet bundle J1Y → Y of Y is an affine bundle morphism over X. In particular, this is an affine connection on the tangent bundle TX of a smooth manifold X. (That is, the connection on an affine bundle is an example of an affine connection; it is not, however, a general definition of an affine connection.  These are related but distinct concepts both unfortunately making use of the adjective "affine".)
